title: Added objects and functions for SKDrawable
body:
This is code for the https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/issues/726 (Missing SkDrawable) issue

Changed samples for testing. Should be reverted.

Not sure, if the memory management is correct. Sorry. Not very firm in C++.

comments.author: charlenni
comments.body: One Problem we now have is, that SKDrawable isn‘t anymore abstract. You suggested to make the ctors internal. Would this help?

comments.author: charlenni
comments.body:
Ok, tested it. It seems, that it isn't possible to create a instance of ````SKDrawable````. So this is good.

Some points for renaming NewPictureSnapshot:
* You find this name in the Skia documentation
* You could write an own event OnNewPictureSnapshot() which is called when calling NewPictureSnapshot. So, if you call the one ToPicture() and the other OnNewPictureSnapshot() than it could get problematic. In this case, we should rename OnNewPictureSnapshot() too. Any good idea? OnGetPicture()?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I see... Names, eh?
Well, we could also go the `Snapshot()` (like `SKSurface`) and then `OnSnapshot` route... ?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I think `Snapshot` is cool. More descriptive - it takes a snapshot of the current drawing. Just like it does for the surface. And, we don't need to have "picture" in the name as there is only one type of snapshot that this can make. I just had a look at the C++ code, and Google is using `makeImageSnapshot` in there, and Miguel renamed it to just `Snapshot`:

```csharp
public SKImage Snapshot () =>
    GetObject<SKImage> (SkiaApi.sk_surface_new_image_snapshot (Handle));
```

Looks like Miguel did not like the name either :)

comments.author: charlenni
comments.body:
I now used Snapshot() and OnSnapshot(). That should be good enough. But the internal functions are still named after the original Skia function names.

How is the documantation made? I thought, it is made by comments in the source code. But this isn't the case. So, where should I add the description of SKDrawable?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: build

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Nice!
So yeah, we keep the native methods the same name to match the C++ API - because we are not the only consumers.

Docs, that is a bit of a process as I usually wait for CI and then run 2 commands - first download all the assets for all the platforms, then run mdoc to generate all the various API docs and diffs. But, Let me see if I can create a new cake task just to generate the minimum for adding summaries and that. CI appears to be having issues accessing the hard disks. I really, really need to move this over to Azure DevOps to get a clean bot each time.

comments.author: charlenni
comments.body: This means, that I don‘t write any documentation?

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
Yeah :)
I tried to get something to work, but I need to bump the versions. And, for some reason both mdoc and the comparer just stopped working :(

I need to fix the scripts a bit more... This is good though, I can now see all the failings of the process.
